elements.text:
You are at work and hear some of your coworkers having a conversation behind you. As you listen, you realize that you were not invited to a small gathering, and a few of your coworkers and friends were all hanging out without you. 

Here are some behaviors that someone might do at that moment or in the future:

texts: I want to ignore them for not inviting me, but remind myself that would be childish.
I say hi to my coworkers when I see them around our office.
I want to gossip about how awful it was that I wasn't invited, but decide that would not be helpful.
I cry and think about other times I've been excluded.
I'll ask some of my coworkers to hang out later this week.
